keybinding.description: Set the keybinding to call the menu

dataService.tooltip: You can choose between several different weather forecast providers. Some providers require a API key to work, some have regional limits, differ in forecast length, and they all need a functional internet connection to work. The options are described in detail on the Cinnamon Spices Website which you can access with the button on the Help tab.

apiKey.tooltip: Copy this from your account of the used Data service and paste it here.

manualLocation.tooltip: Enable this if your location is not accurate

location.tooltip: You can enter coordinates 'Latitude,Longitude' (e.g. 51.5085,-0.1257) or use 'City,Country-code' (e.g. London,UK) or try to enter {House number} {Street} {City/Town} {Postcode} {Country}. The search algorithm is very flexible with the format. After 3 seconds without typing the address you entered is replaced automatically for validating your choice.

saveLocation.tooltip: Saves location information to file so you can switch between them with buttons in the applet, which will appear if you have more than one.

getLocation.description: Weather Applet at Cinnamon Spices Website

refreshInterval.tooltip: If you are using a provider with API keys set it to an interval you won't run out of your quota with.

forecastDays.tooltip: Maximum number of days that can be displayed, maximum rows and columns setting in the Presentation tab will affect the final number.

immediatePrecip.tooltip: If you'd like to use this make sure you use your exact coordinates/address as location to help its accuracy. Currently implemented with OpenWeatherMap only.

temperatureUnit.tooltip: Automatic will try to guess your preference based your current display language.

showBothTempUnits.description: Show both temperature units at the same time

distanceUnit.tooltip: Automatic will try to guess your preference based your current display language.

showCommentInPanel.description: Show the weather condition (e.g., "Windy", "Clear") in the panel

tempTextOverride.tooltip:
Available values are: {c} is condition, {t} is temperature and {u} is unit.
Can be used if label does not fit on vertical panel, among other smart things.

useCustomAppletIcons.tooltip: Iconset is weather-icons by Erik Flowers
useCustomAppletIcons.description: Use custom icons on the panel

verticalOrientation.tooltip: Displaying forecasts from top to bottom instead from left to right.

forecastColumns.description: Maximum number of columns for forecast

forecastRows.description: Maximum number of rows for forecast

locationList.tooltip: You have to make sure the Search entry field is unique and your Timezone is in the IANA time zone format (e.g. 'Europe/London')

temperatureHighFirst.description: Show high temperature first in forecast

displayWindAsText.tooltip: Like SE, N instead of direction icons.

shortHourlyTime.description: Only display hours for hourly forecast time
shortHourlyTime.tooltip: Instead of 15:00 or 3:00 pm it will show up as 15 or 3 pm

useSymbolicIcons.tooltip: Does not apply to custom iconset, that is symbolic by default
useSymbolicIcons.description: Use symbolic icons throughout the applet

useCustomMenuIcons.tooltip: Iconset is weather-icons by Erik Flowers
useCustomMenuIcons.description: Use custom icons in the popup menu

more-info-label.description: For detailed information about the applet please go to the Spices Website to find info about known issues, troubleshooting, changelog and more by clicking the button below. Here you can ask questions etc in the comment section by logging in with your Github account.

submitIssue.tooltip:
Opens webpage where you can fill out a new issue for the applet, needs a GitHub account.
 Please make sure that the issue is not already submitted.

issue-reporting-explanation.description: If you find an issue with this applet please make a report by clicking on the button below and login in with your Github account. Before you start writing please make sure that the issue is not already submitted in the issues section. Don't forget to write weather@mockturtl in the top Title field to make it easier for everyone to know that the issue is about the weather applet (the form is for all Cinnamon applets).

loc-info.description: Your location in most cases work automatically but you can enter it manually by coordinates 'Latitude,Longitude' (e.g. 51.5085,-0.1257) or use 'City,Country-code' (e.g. London,UK) or try to enter {House number} {Street} {City/Town} {Postcode} {Country}. The search algorithm is very flexible with the format. After 3 seconds without typing the address you entered is replaced automatically for validating your choice.
